title.en: How names used to get tabooed

utterances.translation: Now, I will talk about how names used to get tabooed.
They all used to die at home.
Right after the death, they would make the coffin and put the body in the bos right where the person died.
They would take the coffin out through the window, not through the door.
They would take the deceased to where s/he was going to be buried.

transcript.default: c̓uy̓iiʔaƛquu huʔacačiʔaƛquu, quuʔas ʔuḥ yaqitʔitq ʔuuksnaʕaaɬ piicksy̓i yaqitʔitq m̓uč̓ičup, yaqitʔitq m̓uʔakʷay̓ap m̓uč̓ičtup č̓ičmaqšiƛ.

transcription.default: c̓uy̓iiʔaƛquu huʔacačiʔaƛquu quuʔas ʔuḥ yaqitʔitq ʔuuksnaʕaaɬ piicksy̓i yaqitʔitq m̓uč̓ičup yaqitʔitq m̓uʔakʷay̓ap m̓uč̓ičtup č̓ičmaqšiƛ

utterances.translation: When they buried the deceased, people would return — the one who looked after the body, the one who clothed the deceased, and the one burned the clothing and other belongings.
They would return to the house of the deceased where they had started off from, and would sit beside the one who has lost the loved one.
There they would get paid right away.
If they served food to people, they would take them home.

transcript.default: ʔuyaaƛ ʔaḥʔaa ʔiiqḥuk, čuu, č̓ič̓iiḥɬiičiƛ̓aqƛ̓iš ʔaḥ ʕimtiiʔi. wikʔaqƛniš ʔuuḥʷʼaɬ ʔaḥ nuuknuukukqin.

transcription.default: ʔuyaaƛ ʔaḥʔaa ʔiiqḥuk čuu č̓ič̓iiḥɬiičiƛ̓aqƛ̓iš ʔaḥ ʕimtiiʔi wikʔaqƛniš ʔuuḥʷʼaɬ ʔaḥ nuuknuukukqin

utterances.translation: This is when they say, “OK, this name would be tabooed. And we would not use our (family’s) song.”

transcript.default: n̓upqʔičḥ, ʔaƛqʔičḥ qacc̓aqʔičḥ, muuqʔičḥ. ʔunicʔaqƛii haptiɬuk, n̓uḥyaqiɬ.

transcription.default: n̓upqʔičḥ ʔaƛqʔičḥ qacc̓aqʔičḥ muuqʔičḥ ʔunicʔaqƛii haptiɬuk n̓uḥyaqiɬ

utterances.translation: It could be one year, two years, three years, or four years. For however long they decided they would hide them away.

transcript.default: wik̓aƛ̓at kuw̓iɬa ʔuḥʷʼaɬʔat ʕimtiiʔakitʔi qʷiquusii ƛawaaqčik, miiɬḥiit̓ana ʕimtii. wikiičiʔat kuw̓iɬa ʔuuḥʷʼaɬʔat.

transcription.default: wik̓aƛ̓at kuw̓iɬa ʔuḥʷʼaɬʔat ʕimtiiʔakitʔi qʷiquusii ƛawaaqčik miiɬḥiit̓ana ʕimtii wikiičiʔat kuw̓iɬa ʔuuḥʷʼaɬʔat

utterances.translation: And as instructed they would not use the name of the deceased or whatever words that were close or similar to that name.

transcript.default: waa, ʔaƛqʔičḥšiʔaƛquu, muuqʔičḥ ʔunicukuusii ʔuušc̓aɬ, ƛ̓iic̓uuʔaƛquu, huʔaas y̓aksaap nuuknuukukʔi, huʔaas ʔuuḥʷʼaɬ ʕimtii.

transcription.default: waa ʔaƛqʔičḥšiʔaƛquu muuqʔičḥ ʔunicukuusii ʔuušc̓aɬ ƛ̓iic̓uuʔaƛquu huʔaas y̓aksaap nuuknuukukʔi huʔaas ʔuuḥʷʼaɬ ʕimtii

utterances.translation: And after two, four, or however many years of the forbidden period, they would give a feast and bring back their songs and start using the name again.
This is what they did long ago.
